The worst affected region in SSA is Southern Africa, with 38,219 cases and 780 deaths. This is followed by West Africa with 36,909 cases and 754 deaths, East Africa with 18,856 cases and 554 deaths, and Central Africa with 17,325 cases and 410 deaths.

The delayed containment of EVD, the inherent weak health systems of many SSA countries and the associated high EVD‐related mortality, led the World Health Organization (WHO) to warn that Africa could be the next COVID‐19 epicenter. It was estimated that there would be 1.3 billion COVID‐19 cases and 3 million deaths.
